title: Like-A-Flight
text: This site was created as the final project for a full-stack development course, so my design and my code. Basically, this website shows a list of available vacations. The user can login and mark the flights that he likes (hey, I didn't come up with the brief).
As an Admin one can edit/add/delete vacations and view a simple chart that shows likes per vacation data Of course, its fully responsive.
BTW, both airplane animation and like button animation are mine and were implemented as a Lottie code

text: This personal portfolio website is part of my portfolio (so meta, I know).
It was built with NextJS/TypeScript, SCSS, and some self-made Lottie animations (the light/dark toggle for example).

title: STW Conditions Map
text: The conditions map visualizes the distribution of StuffThatWorks members across chronic conditions and the interrelationships between those conditions.
By reducing each member's condition report (including all details) to a coordinate, we can plot all members on a single plane, using color to distinguish between conditions.
These are detailed concept mockups of this partially implemented feature
